summary: The winter solstice marks the shortest day and longest night of the year, occurring around December 21st-23rd in the Northern Hemisphere and June 20th-22nd in the Southern Hemisphere. It happens when the Earth's pole is tilted farthest from the Sun. This event has been celebrated in many cultures since ancient times, often with festivals. The solstice symbolizes the Sun's rebirth as the days start getting longer again. Some ancient landmarks are even aligned with the solstice sunrise or sunset.
title: Winter solstice
